civilizationBonuses: Mule Carts cost -25%. Mule Carts replace Lumber Camps and Mining Camps.

Galley-line and Dromons\* fire one additional projectile each, which deal 1 attack and advertised attack respectively.

uniqueUnits.name: Jaguar Warrior

civilizationBonuses: Start the game with an Eagle Scout.
Villagers carry +3 extra resources.

uniqueUnits.description: Infantry hero with a build limit of 1 which heals nearby units

uniqueTechnologies.name: Coiled Serpent Array
uniqueTechnologies.description: Spearman-line and White Feather Guards gain additional hit points when near each other.

uniqueTechnologies.name: Bolt Magazine
uniqueTechnologies.description: Archer-line, War Chariots, and Lou Chuans fire additional projectiles.

civilizationBonuses: Lumberjacks generate 1 food for every 10 wood.
Archery unit technologies at the Archery Range and Blacksmith cost -25%
Siege weapons, War Chariots, and Lou Chuans move +10/15% faster in Castle/Imperial Age

name: Sicilians
teamBonus: Transport Ships have +5 Line of Sight and cost -50%.

uniqueUnits.name: Serjeant
uniqueUnits.description: Heavily-armored infantry unit that can also build Donjons. It is available starting in the Feudal Age, and is upgraded for free upon reaching the Castle Age.

uniqueTechnologies.name: First Crusade
uniqueTechnologies.description: Each Town Center (up to 5) spawns a one-time group of 5 Serjeants; also increases resistance against conversion (+4/+4 min/max conversion intervals, effect identical to Faith).

uniqueTechnologies.name: Hauberk
uniqueTechnologies.description: Knight-line +1/+2 armor.

civilizationBonuses: Start with +100 stone.
Fortifications built 50%, Town Centers built 100% faster.
Land military units (except siege weapons) receive 40% less bonus damage.
Farm upgrades provide additional +125% food.

uniqueBuildings.name: Donjon
uniqueBuildings.description: Watch Tower line replacement which gets stronger when aging up and can train Serjeants and the Spearman line.

name: Slavs
teamBonus: Barracks, Archery Ranges, Stables, and Siege Workshops provide +5 population.

uniqueUnits.name: Boyar
uniqueUnits.description: Heavily armored cavalry, resistant to melee attack.

uniqueTechnologies.name: Detinets
uniqueTechnologies.description: Replaces 40% of Castles' and Towers' stone cost with wood.

uniqueTechnologies.name: Druzhina
uniqueTechnologies.description: Infantry units damage adjacent units in +0.5 tiles radius with 5 damage.

civilizationBonuses: Farmers work 15% faster.
Arson and Gambesons are free.
Siege Workshop units are 15% cheaper.
Monks move 20% faster.

name: Spanish

uniqueUnits.description: Mounted Monk.

uniqueTechnologies.name: Inquisition
uniqueTechnologies.description: Increases conversion speed for Monks and Missionaries. Missionaries +1 range.

uniqueTechnologies.name: Supremacy
uniqueTechnologies.description: Gives Villagers +6 attack, +2/+2 armor, and +40 hit points.

civilizationBonuses: Builders work 30% faster (20% for Wonders).
Blacksmith upgrades don't cost gold.
Cannon Galleon projectiles can track moving targets and move faster.
Gunpowder units fire 18% faster.
Receive 20 gold for each technology researched.

name: Tatars
teamBonus: Mounted archers have +2 Line of Sight.

uniqueUnits.name: Keshik
uniqueUnits.description: Cavalry that generates gold with each attack.

uniqueUnits.description: Camel that explodes like a Petard, with attack bonuses against mounted units and elephants.

uniqueTechnologies.name: Silk Armor
uniqueTechnologies.description: Scout Cavalry line, Steppe Lancers and mounted archers have +1/+1 armor.

uniqueTechnologies.name: Timurid Siegecraft
uniqueTechnologies.description: Trebuchets have +2 range.

civilizationBonuses: Herdable animals contain +50% food.
Units do +20% damage when attacking from higher elevations (+50% instead of +25%).
Parthian Tactics and Thumb Ring are free.
Two Sheep spawn near newly-constructed Town Centers starting in the Castle Age.

name: Teutons
teamBonus: Units and buildings resist conversion (+3/+1 min/max conversion intervals).

uniqueTechnologies.name: Crenellations

civilizationBonuses: Monks have double healing range.
Towers garrison twice as many units.
Murder Holes and Herbal Medicine are free.
Farms are 40% cheaper.
Town Centers can garrison +10 units.
Barracks and Stable units receive +1/+2 melee armor in the Castle/Imperial Age.
